Olfactory epithelium main supporting cel.Definition: So called supporting or sustentacular cell, that spans the depth of the olfactory epithelium, with cell bodies in an approximate layer near the surface, and microvilli extending into the overlying mucus.  The cytoplasm contains large dense granules that are released into the mucus.  Their electrophysiological properties are similar to those of glial cells (high membrane potential, low input resistance).  They are coupled with each other through gap junctions.
